alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:04PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Neshoba County through 145 PM CDT... At 103 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dixon, or 7 miles north of Prospect, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Neshoba around 110 PM CDT. Philadelphia around 115 PM CDT. Bethsaida around 120 PM CDT. Burnside around 125 PM CDT. Forestdale around 130 PM CDT. Nanih Waiya around 140 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Tucker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and east central Mississippi.
